website_summaries.verdict: Newest version of Lobster Sports' tennis machine includes a match play simulation mode. Creates a variety of shots.
pros: Offers ability to program the machine for multiple kinds of shots, including horizontal, vertical, or both
Includes wireless control unit for changing settings on the fly
Can set random ball patterns to simulate a match
cons: Build quality and longevity of the machine are questionable
Price is high versus older Lobster models

customer_reviews.title: Machine isn't relable.
customer_reviews.text: Machine didn't function at All. Would not do anything. Don't recommend Lobster Tennis ball pitching unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying my Lobster!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second review of the machine. I would give it 5 stars, but at first I have received a malfunctioning unit, which I have returned for free and got a brand new replacement that works great! Plus, I have received a fast charger as a bonus. Good quality product and great customer service! But - four stars for now.
customer_reviews.author: Inessa Maslova

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. There are a lot of different setting which makes it great for advanced levels as well as amateurs. I will say that the packaging was poor and pieces arrived broken however they were fairly inexpensive to replace. Amazon will not take this unit back because it has a battery in it. So I had to work directly with lobster who was fantastic. Amazon gave me money off of the unit so I can replace the parts directly through lobster.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Undependable Cheaply Made Product for Expensive Prices
customer_reviews.text: Design was poorly planned as control issues could have easily been fixed or prevented. Consistency of the machine ball placement is awful for the value it is supposed to provide. Customer service is even worse as they want you to buy more that doesn't even solve their issues.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Family Home Treasures

customer_reviews.title: The settings are good but the material need to be sturdy for usage
customer_reviews.text: This is a flimsy product with its parts falling apart. The settings are good but the material need to be sturdy for usage.
customer_reviews.author: HolyCow

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the right purchase
customer_reviews.text: This has been a terrific purchase so far and very happy with the product. It would have been nice to have the remote included and that seems to be awfully expensive as a side item but other than that we are very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Mangold

customer_reviews.title: this has been a good purchase. I love playing with it
customer_reviews.text: this has been a good purchase. I love playing with it. easy to use. only reason I gave it 4 stars is that on horizontal variance mode, it hits a few balls out of bounds, more than I would expect. could be just my settings and I would need to set it back a bit. but still verry happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.K.

customer_reviews.title: Broke a month after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Only had ball machine for a month and it is already broken
customer_reviews.author: gary clay

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying my Lobster Elite machine.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with the performance of this machine, it helps me improved my backend and swing + cardio. Good value for the money. I am using it everyday and getting better.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Bourget

customer_reviews.title: Best thing is it's size.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return as spinning wheel inside came off. While it worked, was great. Kind of pricey for something so simplistic.
customer_reviews.author: Delzog

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Have used it about 11 hours so far and no problems whatsoever. Has not jammed once. Only using regular tennis balls. I did buy the fast charger and the Lobster storage cover, but did not buy the remote because of high cost and unflattering comments. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stephjam63

customer_reviews.title: great for tennis work out
customer_reviews.text: great for tennis work out, mid range functions does a great job
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mc- Dad

customer_reviews.title: Love this. My husband got it for me for ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this. My husband got it for me for my birthday. We use it several times a week and have had no problems with it. Most fun birthday present ever.
customer_reviews.author: nj

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little machine. Great workout or practice. One charge lasts for 3 two hour trips to the courts. Make sure you buy the fast charger!
customer_reviews.author: TheMegas

customer_reviews.title: Elite success !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Elite 2 in late July of 2014, my then 9 yr son had a 4-6 record in jr 12s div. Since then he has compiled a record of 24-12 and climbed in the rankings. He loves it because he can work on all aspects of his game and hit for hours. What an awesome machine.
customer_reviews.author: A Jones

customer_reviews.title: Greatly recommended!  Three years and still humming like day one.
customer_reviews.text: Our third season on the machine so far and it still spits out ball like day one. Everything works great on this toy: top spin, speed, duration, panning, etc. It's definitely a head turner for many as people actually stop and watch us get a work out from this machine. It's a bit bulky to pick up and sit in the cargo of my van, but no big deal. The handle collapses easily. Have already talked two friends into buying one for themselves after trying out ours. Not a cheap accessory for your tennis hobby, but oh well, you get what you pay for!!
customer_reviews.author: Jacques

customer_reviews.title: Very nice ball machine
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ball machine. It is fairly consistent and the battery will last more than 2 hours. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good but elevation adjustment is a problem
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing tranning tool. Having a little trouble adjusting the elevation, it reaches a downard limit that is still very high. Balls cross the net very high. Even with this problem, I like the machine a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Battery died in a couple of months. Manufacturer won’t replace.
customer_reviews.author: Haytham Elzaim

customer_reviews.title: Purchased with a friend for her. She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: There's no more waiting for a partner or straggler to show up on the courts. She's getting a good work out and can work on her backhand, or forehand, etc at her leisure. I have not used it, but all reports are that the Lobster is great!
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Ball Machine
customer_reviews.text: This thing came fully charged and ready to go. After 1-2 hours of use it still had plenty of juice left. The controls are easy to use. Its biggest limitation is the angle which is up to a maximum of 50 degrees vertical, but this is still adequate to get some overhead practice. It can simulate just about anything you want. Follow the directions when you get it. The battery really does need to be charged when not in use for a while. The biggest con is that its a bit clumsy to lift ... but its not too bad. Overall, I highly recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fife

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Battery seems to last longer than advertised Mike Brown Renton, WA
customer_reviews.author: mike brown

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine for about three weeks and so far it worked nicely. It has jammed often initially and I realized it was due to the new tennis balls. Now it may still jam, but rarely, and easy to resolve. Just hope it will work as good as now in the future.
customer_reviews.author: jiaming

customer_reviews.title: Great Tennis Training Tool
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Rotation left & right / up & down disperses shots well across court Great for doubles practice Good speed and spin options Battery lasts a long time Cons: Flimsy metal handle that is hard to fold down as buttons must be pushed in with a pointed object Cheap wheels If you buy the remote as an add-on...good luck finding any instructions in the package or on the website. You'll need to call.
customer_reviews.author: GS1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This machine is perfect for the weekend warrior. It gives you a good workout and it's easy to set up. The machine is almost 50 lbs so it requires muscles if you're putting it in the back of your car. Get the fast charger to save on time and it also protects the unit from overcharging. I have about 60-70 tennis balls and it gives you a good 6-7 minutes if set at the slowest feed. Now, I don't have to wait for my tennis buddies.
customer_reviews.author: PanksNatDedo

customer_reviews.title: I've been using it for a month and it's great to be able to control the spin and feed ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a month and it's great to be able to control the spin and feed speed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball Machine!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a couple of weeks and so far it has exceeded my expectations. Love the spin and triple oscillation features. I also like the portability of this ball machine. The only down side would be the handholds that are provided at the underside of the machine for lifting. This puts pressure on the back when lifting/ unloading the ball machine from the trunk. Overall, I still like the portability of this machine compared to the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: Replicates play
customer_reviews.text: This works great. The side to side and up-down shot to shot adjustments mimic play. You can also adjust the spins but on this model the spins will not vary shot to shot. The top speed is not very high. Otherwise it does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Be aware
customer_reviews.text: The condition of the machine is not what I expected. The ball machine stops working after 45 minutes but eventually starts up. I am not sure if this will continue to happen if so then it is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: VA for Ever

customer_reviews.title: What a workout
customer_reviews.text: In order to get back into tennis shape and good shape in general, highly recommend using one of these machines. Hits a pattern of 6-8 inches, but when a ball is coming at you at 75mph you cant really expect any better for the price. If you cant purchase one definitely see if you can rent one. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J>J>

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine, Oscillation Function is Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: We've used this 3 times now and love it. Works great, very consistent throws, pretty quiet, and the oscillation function gives you a good workout and real world practice.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal

customer_reviews.title: Good Ball Machine
customer_reviews.text: Machine came in about a week. It is a little heavy. Ball placement was fairly acurate. Battery lasted quite long. Great for practice. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I used it for 6 time during a 2-year period. The low battery light came on today and I tried to charge it but the green light that indicates charge never comes up. The red light was on the whole time after I plugged in the charger. I looked it up on the internet and found a video from the ball machine company saying, in my case, the battery is dead and need a new one. It’s really unbelievable that I spent $1300 dollars on this machine and the battery is dead after 6 uses of 30 minutes
customer_reviews.author: Poppy box

customer_reviews.title: Love the Lobster
customer_reviews.text: When I first received it, the elevation feature was brokem.. the lobster people shipped me a new unit and now after having it for about a year , I love it... I have used it very hard... When fully charged it lasts a lonf long time... I bought a cheap wall timer switch and charge it for 4 hours until it shuts off.... Couple of things.. Dont put wet balls in it , really messes it up... I use tretorn micro x balls and they work great... The topspin and underspin feature works great... wish I would have gotten a remote control however...
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: OMG i was so disappointed. I should have done more research
customer_reviews.text: Couldnt wait for the machine to come to try it out. But then I discovered for $1400 bucks it doesnt come with 2-line function!!! The next model up does. OMG i was so disappointed. I should have done more research.
customer_reviews.author: trinhinc

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: It exactly what I wanted. Absolutely love this. Would recommend to any tennis player. Will help take my game to another level for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboys fan

product_meta.title: Lobster Sports – Elite Two Battery Powered Tennis Ball Machine – Triple Oscillation – Top & Backspin – 80mph Throws – 60° Lobs – 4 to 8 Hour Runtime – 44 lb – Portable – Charger Included
product_meta.description: The elite two tennis ball machine is one of Lobster Sports’ best-selling products. The outstanding feature of the elite two is its triple oscillation function, which simulates match play by combining vertical and horizontal oscillation to throw balls throughout the entire court – left, right, short, and deep. The horizontal "sweep" allows for random ball throws to the forehand, backhand, and center positions in a random pattern. Vertical oscillation allows for balls to be thrown at random depths throughout the court. You can use either oscillation feature individually or both in combination. The elite two challenges tennis players of all levels and experience, helping to improve reaction time, overall fitness, foot speed and agility. This battery-operated tennis ball machine is a reliable hitting partner that launches all kinds of throws, including sky-high lobs, blistering speeds of 80 mph, both top and backspin, to take your training to new levels. The many features included on the elite two will help develop all strokes, taking practice beyond backhands and forehands. The elite’s sleek hopper holds 150 balls and the long-lasting, high-capacity, rechargeable battery will supply 4 to 8 hours of court time. Included with the machine is Lobster’s standard dual-voltage charger (100-240v) which has built-in trickle technology to ensure your battery will never overcharge. The charge time ranges from 12 - 24 hours depending on battery level. Additional power supply options including ac/dc are available from Lobster Sports. Built with 8 inch, all-terrain wheels, the elite can easily travel over any surface and onto the court. At 44 pounds, the compact design with inverting hopper and folding metal handle makes it easy to transport the machine in any vehicle as well as easy to store when not in use. Upright, the elite measures 29 x 43 x 15.5 inches. When folded down, it is 29 x 21 x 15.5 inches. Optional accessories including standard and smartphone remote control options, premium fast charger, external battery pack for extended playtime and storage cover are available. Lobster Sports has been making tennis ball machines since 1970 and stands by their products, which are protected by a two-year warranty. Engineered to last for many years and to withstand frequent use, Lobster ball machines, just like a car, can last for decades if properly maintained. The Lobster Sports elite two ball machine can be a tennis players life-long training partner that can significantly improve their game - which makes it an exceptional value.
feature_bullets: TRIPLE OSCILLATION: The Lobster Sports elite two tennis ball machine is built with unique triple oscillation. It oscillates both vertically and horizontally, the first engineering design in tennis ball machines to simulate match play.

DURABLE YET LIGHTWEIGHT: This tennis ball machine was designed to hold up against frequent use. Weighing only 42 pounds, the elite two is easy to load into your vehicle and unload. The durable elite two challenges tennis players of all levels.

FOUR TO EIGHT HOURS OF BATTERY LIFE: Lobster Sports has designed the elite two with a long-lasting, high-capacity battery. A four- to eight-hour battery life helps ensure plenty of court time between recharges.

IMPROVE YOUR GAME: The elite two tennis ball machine has multiple features for helping tennis players improve their reaction time and overall game. Practice against sky-high lobs and blistering speeds of 80 mph. Feed rate: 2-12 seconds

CHALLENGES ALL STROKES: This battery-operated tennis ball machine will challenge all your strokes, not just the forehand and backhand. The elite two combines a great price with never-seen triple oscillation.
